result.execSummary:
The defendant RICO R VELASQUEZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: - Consecutive to any other sentence. Sentence is to commence immediately if not already serving a sentence. Court grants the defendant good time and 54 days of sentence credit.
- Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
- Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. RICO R VELASQUEZ

defendant.name: VELASQUEZ, RICO R

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel
Motion and prop. order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
10:34 AM Defendant RICO R VELASQUEZ in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow appeared by video for RICO R VELASQUEZ.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant regarding counsel. Defendant requests to proceed without counsel. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Court instrucsts Atty Zamzow to provide an order and Judge will sign it. ADA McElroy recites offer, will dismiss the repeater upon plea to the charge and requests jail and court costs and defendant is free to argue. Defendant concurs and enters a plea of NO CONTEST.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on Obstructing, striking the repeater. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by ADA. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-6 months county jail, consecutive to any other sentence. Sentence is to commence immediately if not already serving a sentence.  
-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court grants the defendant good time and 54 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 10:45 AM



Court adjourned at 10:
Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel (Atty Jeanne Zamzow)
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report - qualifies but no attorney appointed yet
Status hearing on September 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:14 AM Defendant RICO R VELASQUEZ in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he will proceed without counsel. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. ADA states he has not made an offer on this case. Court sets for Status Hearing on September 14, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 10:16 AM
Status hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:13 AM Defendant RICO R VELASQUEZ in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Def has not contacted the public defender's office. Court instructs def on how to obtain an attorney. Court sets status for Sep 6, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 11:14 AM.
Second appearance on August 2, 2022 at 10:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for RICO R VELASQUEZ
Current: 571 County Road A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 07-25-2022)
Prior: 323 S WASHINGTON ST, BERLIN, WI 54923

1:22 PM Defendant RICO R VELASQUEZ appeared by video, in custody and without counsel.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. No objections to holding this hearing via zoom. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Defendant stands mute, Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on his behalf. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $5,000 cash bond. Court will set for Status of Counsel on August 2, 2022 at 10:45 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:24 p.m.

9:49 AM Defendant RICO R VELASQUEZ not in court, Attorney Gerise Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Def not in court or on zoom. Court issues a warrant - forthwith.


Court adjourned at 9:49 AM.
